UNKNOWNCALLERID.title: Unknwon Caller ID
UNKNOWNCALLERID.info: Mapping Urban Communication Lifelines through Disappearing Public Telephones
UNKNOWNCALLERID.description: The piece captures public telephones within the author's urban environment, documenting the GPS coordinates of each one. As communication technology evolves, public telephones have become overlooked objects. The author seeks to empathize with those who have lost access to communication devices like mobile phones, exploring the sentiment of searching for communication lifelines in the city. By locating these disappearing public telephones, they ultimately create a survival map of urban communication spots.

CCC.title: Crowd Cloud Crowded
CCC.info: Exploring Generative AI in the Context of Data Cities
CCC.description: Through the interdisciplinary collaboration of Yu-Hsuan Chiu and Yu-Lin Tsai, 'CROWD / CLOUD / CROWDED' presents a generative AI response within the context of data cities. Leveraging social media data, the project showcases emotion generation and interactive interfaces, delving into reflections on the standardization of individual consciousness. It observes the interaction between AI and social media.

ASYNCCOMMV1.title: Asynchronous Communication Vol.1
ASYNCCOMMV1.info: Exploring Asynchronous Communication through Handmade Photography
ASYNCCOMMV1.description: This book presents online chat room communication through handmade photography. Unlike face-to-face conversations, online chats often lack continuity, leading to communication breakdowns without facial cues. Created by authors from Taiwan(Yu-Lin Tsai) and Switzerland(Yi-Kai Chen), the book documents a month-long exchange solely through photos. Viewers decide the conversation's pace, achieving a unique asynchronous communication experience.

THE3RDCOLLAPSE.title: The 3rd Collapse
THE3RDCOLLAPSE.info: Exploring the Intersection of Stillness and Decay
THE3RDCOLLAPSE.description: This piece contrasts the before and after of still-life decay through photography, merging the frozen-in-time nature of imagery with the inevitable decay of the film itself as a material. It presents a series of images with multiple layers of contrast. Ultimately, it is presented in the form of a double-sided photography book, printed on fragile paper, ensuring that the book gradually deteriorates during its exhibition as viewers flip through its pages.

ANALOGRANDOMGENERATOR.title: Analog Random Generator
ANALOGRANDOMGENERATOR.info: Exploring Analog Randomness through Dust Simulation
ANALOGRANDOMGENERATOR.description: This work uses dust to mimic analog randomness, transforming digital noise into physical forms. While computer-generated randomness isn't truly random, this device simulates genuine randomness with dust. It also ties to the Infinite Monkey Theorem, suggesting that over time, it can generate any image, including photos from each piece exhibited.

GRADIENT_SCOTOMA.title: Gradient Scotoma
GRADIENT_SCOTOMA.info: Mutual Observation from the Perspectives of AI and Art
GRADIENT_SCOTOMA.description: As a collaborative project between AI engineer Yu-Lin Tsai and artist Mu Duan, this exhibition delves into the concept of artificial intelligence as a black box, employing metaphors of gradients and blind spots. Through the intersection of technology and art, the creators offer a unique perspective on the relationship between humans and AI, guiding viewers to explore the convergence of technology and culture.
